Description: Papyrus. Early demotic narrative or petition/memorandum. The papyrus is torn on both sides but the upper and lower margins are preserved. There are 21 lines on the recto with a further five on the verso in what is probably the same hand (but in larger writing). The papyrus was subsequently reused, as beneath and upside down to the text on the verso there are isolated numbers and annotations.
Curator's comments: Under study by Naglaa Ezzeldeen (Helwan University, Cairo).

Because the papyrus is torn on both sides and an unquantiifiable amount of text lost, there is no coherent text. It is written in the first person singular, second person singular and plural and third person singular. The absence of any opening introductory remarks would suggest that it may belong to a narrative or some sort.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (381013) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/381013)
